IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDescription: To enhance the vitality and deepen the cultural life of San Diego by presenting and producing a dynamic range of performing arts for our increasingly diverse community.
IRS990.MissionDescription: To enhance the vitality and deepen the cultural life of San Diego by presenting and producing a dynamic range of performing arts for our increasingly diverse community.
IRS990.Description: The Society is the largest multi-disciplinary presenter in San Diego and annually produces a nationally recognized summer festival. It's mission is to enhance the vitality and deepen the cultural life of San Diego by presenting and producing a dynamic range of performing arts for our increasingly diverse community.

Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.ReturnReference: Part XIII, Line 2d: Other expenses and losses per audited F/S
Part XII, Line 2d: Other revenue amounts included in F/S but not included on form 990
Part V, Line 4: Intended uses of the endowment fund.
Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Explanation: THE INTENDED USE OF THE ENDOWMENT FUNDS IS TO SUPPORT THE GENERAL OPERATIONS OF LA JOLLA MUSIC SOCIETY.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: Form 990, Part VI, Line 19: Other Organization Documents Publicly Available
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THE ORGANIZATION MAKES ITS AUDITED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS, FORM 990, GOVERNING DOCUMENTS AND POLICIES AVAILABLE UPON REQUEST. THE ORGANIZATION ALSO USES WWW.GUIDESTAR.ORG TO DISCLOSE ITS FORM 990.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: Form 990, Part VI, Line 12c: Explanation of Monitoring and Enforcement of Conflicts
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: All employees are encouraged to report any conflicts of interest to the president. Failure to report conflicts are grounds for termination. The president must report to the board any conflicts of interest. In regard to Board members, La Jolla Music Society sends out an annual email to all board members asking if any conflicts of interest may exist. Board members are also asked about conflicts of interest during the Annual meeting or the first meeting of the new fiscal year.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: Form 990, Part VI, Line 11: Form 990 Review Process
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THE BUSINESS MANAGER REVIEWS THE FORM 990 IN DETAIL. HE PROVIDES THE AUDIT COMMITTEE WITH A GENERAL OVERVIEW OF THE FORM 990 AND ITS COMPONENT PARTS. HE ALSO HOLDS A SUMMARY MEETING WITH THE PRESIDENT/ARTISTIC DIRECTOR AND PRESIDENT OF THE BOARD WHO PROVIDE FINAL APPROVAL.
